bibl.title: Ceramic Evidence for Egyptian Links with Northern Jordan in the 6th-8th centuries A.D.
bibl.note: The period between the 6th and the 8th centuries A.D. covers the change-over from Byzantine to Islamic rule, when alterations to economic networks might be expected to occur.

bibl.title: Trade, Contact, and the Movement of Peoples in the Eastern Mediterranean. Studies in Honour of J. Basil Hennessy

bibl.seg: WATSON Pamela M., Ceramic Evidence for Egyptian Links with Northern Jordan in the 6th-8th centuries A.D.

Stephen BOURKE and Jean-Paul DESCOEUDRES (Edd.), Trade, Contact, and the Movement of Peoples in the Eastern Mediterranean. Studies in Honour of J. Basil Hennessy = Mediterranean Archaeology. Supplement 3 (Sydney, 1995) pp. 303-320, 9 figg.
The period between the 6th and the 8th centuries A.D. covers the change-over from Byzantine to Islamic rule, when alterations to economic networks might be expected to occur.
